description: Table by antidiagonals of n-Stohr sequences: T(n,k) is least positive integer not the sum of at most n distinct terms in the n-th row from T(n,1) through to T(n,k-1).
formula: If k<=n+1 then T(n, k)=2^(k-1), while if k>n T(n, k)=(2^n-1)(k-n)+1
crossrefs: Rows include A000027, A033627, A026474, A051039, A051040. Diagonals include A000079, A000225, A033484, A036563, A048487. A048483 can be seen as half this table.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 29 2001
